qa_pairs.question: When did Billerud change its name from BillerudKorsnäs to Billerud, and what event prompted this change according to the source?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>The company changed its name from BillerudKorsnäs to Billerud in 2022 following the acquisition of Verso Corporation.<cite>[S2][S13][S14]</cite></statement> <statement>The acquisition of the US-based coated paper company Verso Corporation in 2022 prompted the name change to better cater to international customers.<cite>[S13][S14]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Billerud


# Billerud



**Billerud AB** is a Swedish pulp and paper manufacturer with headquarters in Solna, Sweden. [S2] The company simplified its name from BillerudKorsnäs to Billerud after the acquisition of Verso 2022, an American producer of coated paper. [S3] Billerud has nine production facilities in Sweden, Finland and the USA with around 5,900 employees in over 13 countries. [S4] Its production units are located in Grums, Skärblacka, Frövi/Rockhammar, Gävle and Karlsborg in Sweden, Jakobstad in Finland, Escanaba, Quinnesec and Wisconsin Rapids in the US. [S5] ## History

The company was formed in November 2012 through the merger of Billerud AB and Korsnäs AB. [S6] In the 2012 merger, Billerud was the formal buyer. [S7] Korsnäs' owner, Investment Kinnevik AB, received a sum of SEK 3.2 billion as well as 25.1% of the votes in the new company and consequently became the largest owner in the merged BillerudKorsnäs. [S8] Behind the merger, was an ambition to become an internationally leading packaging manufacturer. [S9] During the same year, BillerudKorsnäs acquired paper production facilities both in Jakobstad and Tervasaari, Valkeakoski, in Finland from UPM Kymmene. [S10] Valkeakoski was closed down and the paper machine for MG paper was moved to Skärblacka mill in 2017. [S11] In 2013, Kinnevik sold its shares in BillerudKorsnäs to pension firms AMF, Alecta and the Fourth Swedish National Pension Fund. [S12] In March 2022, BillerudKorsnäs completed its acquisition of the US-based coated paper company, Verso Corporation for $825m in cash. [S13] As a result of the acquisition, according to a press release in October 2022, the company changed its name from BillerudKorsnäs to Billerud "to cater to its international customers". [S14] ## Production units


### In Sweden

* Gruvön Mill – produces fluting, liners, liquid packaging board and pulp. [S15] * Skärblacka Mill – produces white machine glazed kraft paper, brown sack paper, fluting and pulp. [S16] * Karlsborg Mill – produces kraft paper, sack paper, formable paper (FibreForm®) and pulp
* Frövi Mill – produces cartonboard and liquid packaging board
* Gävle Mill – produces liquid packaging board and liners. [S17] ### In the US

* Escanaba Mill – produces graphic papers used in commercial printing, media and marketing. [S18] * Quinnesec Mill – produces graphic papers used in commercial printing, media and marketing, and pulp. [S19] * Wisconsin Rapids Converting Facility – converts cartonboard and rolls of paper into sheets. [S20] ### In Finland

* Jakobstad Mill – produces kraft- and sack paper for food packaging and carrier bags. [S21] ## Regions and segments

Billerud's organization is structured through the regions Europe and North America. [S22] In 2023, region Europe corresponds to 65% of the group's net sales, while region North America corresponds to 28%. [S23] ## Corporate leadership


### Chairmen of the Board

* Hannu Ryöppönen, 2012–2014
* Lennart Holm, 2014–2019
* Jan Åström 2019-2021
* Jan Svensson 2021-

### Chief Executive Officer

* Per Lindberg, 2012–2017
* Petra Einarsson, 2018–2019
* Lennart Holm, 2019-2020 (acting CEO)
* Christoph Michalski, 2020-2023
* Ivar Vatne, 2023-

## Ownership Structure

The largest shareholders are AMF Pension & Funds with 15.62 percent of the votes and Frapag Beteiligungholding AG with 12.06 percent (as of December 31, 2024).

qa_pairs.question: Which countries host Billerud's production facilities, and what specific mills are located in each region according to the source?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Billerud's production facilities are located in Sweden, Finland, and the USA.<cite>[S3]</cite></statement> <statement>In Sweden, the production facilities include Gruvön Mill, Skärblacka Mill, Karlsborg Mill, Frövi Mill, and Gävle Mill.<cite>[S15][S16][S17]</cite></statement> <statement>In Finland, the production facility is Jakobstad Mill.<cite>[S21]</cite></statement> <statement>In the USA, the production facilities are Escanaba Mill, Quinnesec Mill, and Wisconsin Rapids Converting Facility.<cite>[S18][S19][S20]</cite></statement>

qa_pairs.question: How is Billerud's regional sales distribution structured, and what percentage of net sales did each region contribute in 2023?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Billerud's regional sales distribution is structured through the regions Europe and North America.<cite>[S22]</cite></statement> <statement>In 2023, the Europe region contributed 65% of the group's net sales, while the North America region contributed 28%.<cite>[S23]</cite></statement>

* Jan Svensson 2021-

### Chief Executive Officer

* Per Lindberg, 2012–2017
* Petra Einarsson, 2018–2019
* Lennart Holm, 2019-2020 (acting CEO)
* Christoph Michalski, 2020-2023
* Ivar Vatne, 2023-

## Ownership Structure

The largest shareholders are AMF Pension & Funds with 15.62 percent of the votes and Frapag Beteiligungholding AG with 12.06 percent (as of December 31, 2024).
chunk_list:
[S1] Billerud


# Billerud



**Billerud AB** is a Swedish pulp and paper manufacturer with headquarters in Solna, Sweden. [S2] The company simplified its name from BillerudKorsnäs to Billerud after the acquisition of Verso 2022, an American producer of coated paper. [S3] Billerud has nine production facilities in Sweden, Finland and the USA with around 5,900 employees in over 13 countries. [S4] Its production units are located in Grums, Skärblacka, Frövi/Rockhammar, Gävle and Karlsborg in Sweden, Jakobstad in Finland, Escanaba, Quinnesec and Wisconsin Rapids in the US. [S5] ## History

The company was formed in November 2012 through the merger of Billerud AB and Korsnäs AB. [S6] In the 2012 merger, Billerud was the formal buyer. [S7] Korsnäs' owner, Investment Kinnevik AB, received a sum of SEK 3.2 billion as well as 25.1% of the votes in the new company and consequently became the largest owner in the merged BillerudKorsnäs. [S8] Behind the merger, was an ambition to become an internationally leading packaging manufacturer. [S9] During the same year, BillerudKorsnäs acquired paper production facilities both in Jakobstad and Tervasaari, Valkeakoski, in Finland from UPM Kymmene. [S10] Valkeakoski was closed down and the paper machine for MG paper was moved to Skärblacka mill in 2017. [S11] In 2013, Kinnevik sold its shares in BillerudKorsnäs to pension firms AMF, Alecta and the Fourth Swedish National Pension Fund. [S12] In March 2022, BillerudKorsnäs completed its acquisition of the US-based coated paper company, Verso Corporation for $825m in cash. [S13] As a result of the acquisition, according to a press release in October 2022, the company changed its name from BillerudKorsnäs to Billerud "to cater to its international customers". [S14] ## Production units


### In Sweden

* Gruvön Mill – produces fluting, liners, liquid packaging board and pulp. [S15] * Skärblacka Mill – produces white machine glazed kraft paper, brown sack paper, fluting and pulp. [S16] * Karlsborg Mill – produces kraft paper, sack paper, formable paper (FibreForm®) and pulp
* Frövi Mill – produces cartonboard and liquid packaging board
* Gävle Mill – produces liquid packaging board and liners. [S17] ### In the US

* Escanaba Mill – produces graphic papers used in commercial printing, media and marketing. [S18] * Quinnesec Mill – produces graphic papers used in commercial printing, media and marketing, and pulp. [S19] * Wisconsin Rapids Converting Facility – converts cartonboard and rolls of paper into sheets. [S20] ### In Finland

* Jakobstad Mill – produces kraft- and sack paper for food packaging and carrier bags. [S21] ## Regions and segments

Billerud's organization is structured through the regions Europe and North America. [S22] In 2023, region Europe corresponds to 65% of the group's net sales, while region North America corresponds to 28%. [S23] ## Corporate leadership


### Chairmen of the Board

* Hannu Ryöppönen, 2012–2014
* Lennart Holm, 2014–2019
* Jan Åström 2019-2021
* Jan Svensson 2021-

### Chief Executive Officer

* Per Lindberg, 2012–2017
* Petra Einarsson, 2018–2019
* Lennart Holm, 2019-2020 (acting CEO)
* Christoph Michalski, 2020-2023
* Ivar Vatne, 2023-

## Ownership Structure

The largest shareholders are AMF Pension & Funds with 15.62 percent of the votes and Frapag Beteiligungholding AG with 12.06 percent (as of December 31, 2024).
